channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: Senate set to pass 'Bayanihan 2', work on bills in response to pandemic
item.author: Bella Perez-Rubio
item.description: Senate Majority Leader Miguel Zubiri announced that the upper chamber on Tuesday afternoon would be passing the extension of the Bayanihan act or Bayanihan 2 on its third and final reading.

item.title: Can cops confiscate your protest placards? Guevarra says 'no'
item.author: Kristine Joy Patag
item.description: Placards or banners that express one’s position on national issues cannot be subjected to confiscation, Justice Secretary Menardo Guevarra said.

item.title: Coronavirus cases hit 82,040 as Duterte addresses pandemic-battered Philippines
item.author: Gaea Katreena Cabico
item.description: As of posting, President Rodrigo Duterte takes the podium to address Filipinos anxious for their lives and uncertain about their future as the virus continues to rage on. He is expected to unveil measures to revive the economy battered by the pandemic.

item.title: National Center for Mental Health chief shot dead in Quezon City
item.author: Franco Luna
item.description: "Cursory examination showed that both of the victims sustained multiple gunshot sounds on the different parts of their bodies. Case held under investigation and follow up," QCPD told reporters.

item.title: COVID-19 infections in Philippines may reach 90,000 by end-July — UP researcher
item.author: Bella Perez-Rubio
item.description: Mathematics professor Guido David, a member of the UP OCTA Research group, relayed these amended figures after the country on Sunday logged over 2,000 coronavirus cases for the fourth consecutive day.

item.title: House to file bill creating Department of Arts and Culture
item.author: Franco Luna
item.description: "In the face of an evolving enemy and a fluid battleground, Congress needs to continue to Adapt, Innovate, and Manage if we are to stay above water until a vaccine or a cure is found," he also said.

item.title: DOJ on CHR's call for transparency: We are looking into prison situation too
item.author: Kristine Joy Patag
item.description: Justice Secretary Menardo Guevarra said it is “not fair” to criticize his department for a supposed lack of transparency on the conditions in Philippine prisons.

item.title: Protesters call for better COVID-19 response, end to 'tyranny' at ‘SONAgkaisa' protest
item.description: Groups from the sectors of health, labor, education, transport and youth participated in the protest action dubbed as “SONAgkaisa” to voice their criticism of the government’s handling of the coronavirus disease (COVID-19) crisis, the denial of a legislative franchise for media giant ABS-CBN and the enactment of the Anti-Terrorism Act of 2020, which is feared to infringe on people’s fundamental rights.

item.title: Seizure of Pinoy Weekly copies nothing to do with anti-terror law — Gamboa
item.author: Franco Luna
item.description: "If there are people who agree with what they're saying that they were raided, etcetera, then let them file the necessary and appropriate action," Gamboa said.

item.title: Senate eyes July 31 or August 3 as starting dates for PhilHealth probe
item.description: Senate President Tito Sotto said that "as best as possible," those invited to the hearings would be physically present as the Senate's offices are now equipped with the necessary partitions to maintain social distancing.
